resources.string: GNITS
PHYSICAL EDUCATION
\t The dept. of Physical Education is headed by Dr.M.V.L.Surya Kumari.She has more than 15 years teaching experience in the field of Physical Education.\n\n

\t The department of Physical Education was established in January 2002. The management has appointed coaches for the various games and sports who train the students to participate in inter college and university level competitions and has succeeded in achieving many golden moments for the college.\n\n

The department was established with the following objectives.
 *	 Development of wholesome personality of all the students through their participation in various sports and games.
 *	Development of sports infrastructural facilities.
 *	Preparation of college teams for the inter college and university tournaments in different events.
 *	 Organization of intra college competitions between different departments to provide opportunity for all the students to participate in various sports events.

A Spacious room for INDOOR games is equipped with facilities to play Table tennis, Chess and Carroms.
 An Indoor badminton stadium with two wooden courts.
 A Fitness wing has been established with latest Exercise-Cycle, Twisters and Ab-Slimmer etc.

-> One Basketball court
 -> Two Volleyball courts
 -> Two Throw ball courts
 -> One Handball court
 -> One Kho-Kho field
 -> 200 Mts. Running track

* GNITS got JNTU central zone sports and games girls over all championship from past 8 years consecutively.
 * GNITS got zone-a games and sports over all championship from past 5 years consecutively.
 * From 2003-2014, 86 students represented JNTU in the inter university tournaments.
 * During 2013-14, two tennis players from this college represented JNTU in the central zone all India University Tournament and won Silver Medal and participated in inter zonal Inter University Tournament.
Aboutus
Settings
To provide engineering education in the field of Computer Science with evolving technologies and to produce self motivated, employable individuals to society.\n

1) To pioneer education in Computer Science and Engineering, Mathematics and Sciences, to mould the overall personality of students.
 2)To nurture the students to be dynamic, industry ready and to have multidisciplinary skills and leadership qualities.
 3)To inculcate work ethics and commitment in students for their future endeavours to serve the society.

PEO 1 : The student should be able to apply their knowledge in Mathematics, Science, Engineering as well as Computer Science along with programming skills in their career and higher education.

	 PEO 2 : They are expected to communicate well and get ready for understanding the importance of social, business, technical and ethical aspects with which a process or product is designed.

	 PEO 3 : They should be able to excel in multidisciplinary teams, develop leadership roles and inculcate problem solving capability, design skills and other diverse career paths.

	 PEO 4 : They should develop an interest in knowledge enhancement with the evolving technologies and thinking beyond the present.
\t ECE dept envisions to develop high quality and technically competent women engineers who can address the growing challenges in the modern world with a keen sense of social responsibility.\n

\t To inculcate analytical and design skills ,bridge the gap between academics and industry requirements while nourishing the creative spirits, leader ship qualities and compassion in women engineers with social ethics for the betterment.\n

PEO1: To impart the knowledge of basic sciences , mathematics and programming skills in solving various Engg. problems pertaining to the field of Electronics and Communications.

	 PEO2: To train the students in analyzing , designing and imparting research based knowledge and acquainting them with modern scientific tools.

	 PEO 3:To create professional , ethical environment and to inculcate effective communication skills .

	 PEO 4: To encourage team work and interdisciplinary ideas benefiting the society.

	 PEO 5: To motivate students to be independent with a desire for life long learning and adapt to the changing professional needs .
\t To impart quality education in Electrical and Electronics Engineering for women empowerment.\n

1) Imparting fundamental knowledge in Electrical and Electronics Engineering through well-qualified faculty.

	 2) Providing exposure to current technologies.

	 3) Providing hands-on experience to meet the expectations of the industry.

	 4) Facilitating individual and team activities to enhance personality and soft skills.

1. Excel in chosen career.

	 2. Work effectively as an individual and a team member.

	 3. Contribute to the community/society development through acquired knowledge and skills.

	 4. Continuous upgradation of knowledge and skills.
\t To build a collaborative academic environment that responds swiftly to the challenges of Information technology.\n

To foster an intellectual environment that delivers virtuous Information Technocrats with commitment to industry and society by strengthening the logical, analytical and applicative skills to excel academically and professionally. To inculcate good communication skills in students and introduce them to various codes of professional practices for carrying out effective team collaborations and project management in the field of IT.\n

PEO1: To provide students with a compelling foundation in Engineering and Basic Sciences that will further help them conduct investigations of complex problems.

	 PEO2: To apply scientific and Engineering methodologies using modern tools and techniques in the analysis, design, implementation and evaluation of information in the field of IT.â€‹

	 PEO3: To promote life long learning and help students in aiming for higher education and become successful Engineers in the society.

	 PEO4: To inculcate strong communication skills, ethics and various codes of professional practices useful in performing effective project management and team collaborations and enable them to sustain and excel in various environments .
\t Imparting quality technical education in the field of Electronics and Telematics Engineering for women empowerment .\n

1)To emerge as a Centre of Academic Excellence in Electronics and Telematics Engineering to face the challenges in the field of information and communication technologies .
 	 2)To create the Educational Environment which enables the students for life long learning.
 	 3)Imparting value based education for women empowerment.

1. Graduates will excel in professional careers in Industry and academics that fulfill the needs of Information and Communication Technology (ICT).

	 2. Graduates will be able to work with advanced technologies relevant to Electronics and Telematics Engineering.

	 3. Graduates will be able to work in diversified teams of multidisciplinary environment to gain engineering breadth.

	 4. Graduates will exhibit all-round education that includes communication skills, ability to work well in a team, an awareness of ethical values and to engage in lifelong learning.
